Supreme Court rules over Minimum Income Requirements for foreign partners Supreme Court rules over Minimum Income Requirements for foreign partners The Supreme Court has ruled that Government financial measures hitting British citizens who want their foreign spouses or partners to join them in the UK do not breach human rights legislation. PUBLISHED: 09:50,   10:03, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 Getty Baby feet (stock image) 
The rules stated that as from 2012 Britons must be earning more than Â£18,600 before they can bring a husband or wife from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) to settle in the UK. 
Previous rules only required a couple to demonstrate that they could maintain themselves without recourse to public funds. 
Critics of the policy had claimed that around 15,000 children have been separated from parents because of the ruling. 
More to follow.
